page.title: 02Industrial history,Paulton.
page.content: Coal has been mined extensively in the area in the past.The last mines closed in the mid_twentieth century. In 1750,one of the first Newcomen atmospheric engines was installed at Paulton Engine pit,for pumping water. The Somerset Coal Canal from Paulton to the Kennet and Avon Canal was opened in 1805.The W.Evans foundry operated at Paulton Engine.It produced gates,fencing and posts which can still be seen in the area. Mining equipment and pumps were also made. The footwear industry developed as a cottage industry.Ashman Brothers shoe factory continues this traditon to the present day. In 1830 a small printing press was established.It grew to become the main industry and largest employer in the area ,Purnells Ltd.
